intro: Daviesia arthropoda, commonly known as the red-stemmed daviesia, is a shrub native to south-eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flower spikes that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Daviesia arthropoda is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is popular in native gardens.
